Enum representing the domain or codomain of a GroundingFunction

ANY = 2¶

REWARD = 5¶
STATE = 6¶
STATE_ACTION = 7¶
STATE_ACTION_NEXTSTATE = 8¶
class src.grounding.base.Grounding(name=None)¶

Bases: object

Parent class for all grounded objects.

property name¶
class src.grounding.base.GroundingFunction(domain: src.grounding.base.Domain, codomain: src.grounding.base.Domain, function: Callable, name: Optional[str] = None)¶

Bases: src.grounding.base.Grounding

Parent class for groundings which are functions.

GroundingFunctions have a specified domain and codomain. They are typically invoked with keyword arguments corresponding to their domain, i.e. door_closed(state=s).

Parameters

  • domain – Domain of the function.

  • codomain – Codomain of the function.

  • function – the actual function.

  • name (optional) – the name of the Grounding.

class src.grounding.base.RLangKnowledge¶

Bases: collections.abc.MutableMapping

Knowledge class

  • stores groundings for retrieval by user

  • this is the base-level knowledge class

author: Benjamin Spiegel (bspiegel@cs.brown.edu), Jennifer Wang (plz put ur email here) date: September 2021

classmethod from_Factor(factor: Factor, name: Optional[str] = None)¶
class src.grounding.state_groundings.Option(initiation: src.grounding.state_groundings.Predicate, policy: src.grounding.state_groundings.Policy, termination: src.grounding.state_groundings.Predicate, name: Optional[str] = None)¶

Bases: rlang.src.grounding.base.Grounding

Grounding object for an option.

Parameters

  • initiation – A Predicate capturing the initiation set of the option

  • policy – A Policy capturing the policy of the option

  • termination – A Predicate capturing the termination set of the option

  • name (optional) – A name for the Option grounding

can_execute(*args, **kwargs) → bool¶

Determines whether the option can be executed in a given state.

Parameters

state – A State object

Returns

bool

class src.grounding.GroundingFunction(domain: src.grounding.base.Domain, codomain: src.grounding.base.Domain, function: Callable, name: Optional[str] = None)¶

Bases: src.grounding.base.Grounding

Parent class for groundings which are functions.

GroundingFunctions have a specified domain and codomain. They are typically invoked with keyword arguments corresponding to their domain, i.e. door_closed(state=s).

Parameters

  • domain – Domain of the function.

  • codomain – Codomain of the function.

  • function – the actual function.

  • name (optional) – the name of the Grounding.
